While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other people's families and homes during busy party moments. Their schemes can be callous but funny along with a twist ending that changes what we thought of them.
There should be a "Merry Snow" instead of Christmas verdict

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a piece of film history it's mostly important to see how and what wrong was done and this applies again. I think everyone should know at least one film from every era of the history with regards to technique (e.g. shape language), how plots develop

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to have you laughing like an idiot throughout its short 89 minute duration, due to its low budget and very poor CGI work.
